meanings.definition: To dissolve or become dissolved in a solvent.
meanings.sent1: She was solvating the sugar in water to make a sweet solution.
meanings.sent2: The salt was solvating in the warm water, disappearing into it.
meanings.sent3: The curious scientist was solvating various powders in different liquids for an experiment.
meanings.sent4: His troubles seemed to be solvating in the peaceful atmosphere of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The dye solvating in the fabric created a beautiful, vibrant color.

meanings.definition: To form a solution with a solvent.
meanings.sent1: The oil was slowly solvating into the vinegar, creating a salad dressing.
meanings.sent2: The sugar was solvating well in the hot tea, sweetening it perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces seemed to be solvating together as the picture started to form.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like solvating two complementary colors, creating a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The music and lyrics solvated seamlessly, creating a beautiful song.

meanings.definition: The act of solvating a substance in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The solvating of the salt in the water was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent2: Her solvating of the ink in the solvent was precise and skillful.
meanings.sent3: The solvating of the chocolate in the milk was a delicious experiment.
meanings.sent4: The solvating of the medicine in the liquid made it easier to swallow.
meanings.sent5: The solvating of the sugar in the coffee created a sweet morning drink.
